prompt: <description>Part 1: Cylindrical Object with Central Hole Create a new coordinate system with no rotation or translation. Sketch: Create a new face. * Loop 1: + Circle 1: Draw a circle with a center at (0.2646, 0.2646) and a radius of 0.2646. * Loop 2: + Circle 1: Draw a circle with a center at (0.2646, 0.2646) and a radius of 0.0529. Extrusion: Extrude the face with a depth of 0.1411 towards the normal and no depth in the opposite direction. Apply a scaling factor of 0.5293 to the sketch. Set the boolean operation to create a new solid body. Part 2: L-shaped Feature Create a new coordinate system with no rotation and a translation vector of (0, 0.1941, 0.1411). Sketch: Create a new face. * Face 1: + Loop 1: - Line 1: Draw a line from (0.4111, 0.0529) to (0.5287, 0.0529). - Arc 1: Draw an arc from (0.4111, 0.0882) to (0.4111, 0.0529) with its center at (0.1171, 0.0706). - Line 2: Draw a line from (0.4111, 0.0882) to (0.5287, 0.0882). - Arc 2: Draw an arc from (0.5287, 0.0882) to (0.5287, 0.0529) with its center at (0.0, 0.0706). * Face 2: + Loop 1: - Line 1: Draw a line from (0.5197, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0). - Line 2: Draw a line from (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0529). - Line 3: Draw a line from (0.75, 0.0529) to (0.5287, 0.0529). - Arc 1: Draw an arc from (0.5287, 0.0529) to (0.5197, 0.0) with its center at (0.5255, 0.0262). * Face 3: + Loop 1: - Arc 1: Draw an arc from (0.5197, 0.1411) to (0.5287, 0.0882) with its center at (0.5255, 0.1149). - Line 1: Draw a line from (0.5287, 0.0882) to (0.75, 0.0882). - Line 2: Draw a line from (0.75, 0.0882) to (0.75, 0.1411). - Line 3: Draw a line from (0.75, 0.1411) to (0.5197, 0.1411). Extrusion: Extrude the face with a depth of 0.4234 towards the normal and no depth in the opposite direction. Apply a scaling factor of 0.75 to the sketch. Set the boolean operation to join the existing body. Final Shape The final shape consists of the Part 1 and Part 2 combined. The shape resembles a washer with an L-shaped feature on one side. The dimensions are: * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.75 * Height: 0.5645 (sum of the extrude depths from Part 1 and Part 2)</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Tapered Top and Bottom Step 1: Create the coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system, to be used as the base for the extrusion. Step 3: Draw the lines for the sketch Draw the following lines in sequential order to form the closed loop (loop_1): - line_1: Start at [0.0, 0.0], End at [0.383, 0.0] - line_2: Start at [0.383, 0.0], End at [0.383, 0.75] - line_3: Start at [0.383, 0.75], End at [0.0, 0.75] - line_4: Start at [0.0, 0.75], End at [0.0, 0.0] Step 4: Scale the 2D sketch Apply a scaling factor of 0.75 to the 2D sketch. Step 5: Transform the 2D sketch Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the euler angles and translation vector. Step 6: Extrude the 2D sketch Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.0011 units in the positive z-direction (towards the normal) and 0 in the negative z-direction (opposite the normal). Step 7: Perform the operations The extrusion process automatically combines the resulting 3D part with any existing bodies based on their relative configurations, without requiring specific boolean operations to be performed. Part Description - Shape: A rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. The top and bottom faces are parallel to each other, and the sides are perpendicular to the top and bottom faces. The top and bottom faces are of equal size, and the sides are of equal length. The top and bottom faces are larger than the sides. - Height: 0.75 - Length: 0.0011 - Width: 0.75 This concludes the instructions for part 1. Assemble the part by following the steps above.</description>

</json>

Extrude the sketch into a 3D model: - Extrude Depth Towards Normal: 0.1875 - Extrude Depth Opposite Normal: 0.1875 Part 2: Parallel Straight Lines Construct two parallel straight lines. Set the coordinate system with the following values: - Euler Angles: (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) - Translation Vector: (0.0, 0.375, 0.0) Create two sketches for the 2D geometry, face 1 and face 2, and define their respective loops with the following lines: Face 1 - line\\_1: Start Point ((0.0, 0.0)), End Point ((0.0111, 0.0)) - line\\_2: Start Point ((0.0111, 0.0)), End Point ((0.0111, 0.0071)) - line\\_3: Start Point ((0.0111, 0.0071)), End Point ((0.0, 0.0071)) - line\\_4: Start Point ((0.0, 0.0071)), End Point ((0.0, 0.0)) Face 2 - line\\_1: Start Point ((0.0, 0.1509)), End Point ((0.0111, 0.1509)) - line\\_2: Start Point ((0.0111, 0.1509)), End Point ((0.0111, 0.158)) - line\\_3: Start Point ((0.0111, 0.158)), End Point ((0.0, 0.158)) - line\\_4: Start Point ((0.0, 0.158)), End Point ((0.0, 0.1509)) Scale the 2D sketches with the provided scaling factor. - Sketch Scale: 0.158 Transform the scaled 2D sketches into 3D sketches using the given Euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the sketch into 3D models: - Extrude Depth Towards Normal: 0.1875 - Extrude Depth Opposite Normal: 0.1875 The resulting models serve as part 1 and part 2 of the assembly, which forms the final desired three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Remember to use the appropriate join, cut, or intersect boolean operations to integrate each new part with the existing CAD model per instructions provided.</description>
